means: 移动，搬动
搬家
行动
进展
（机器等）开动
提议
使感动
摇动
变化
改变
迁移
Management of Value Engineering 价值工程管理

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"运动"之意。
means: motion ： 指不处于静止状态而在移动的过程中，强调运动本身，而不涉及其动因。
move ： 着重开始的行动或变化。
movement ： 通常抽象地指有规则的动作或定向运动，特指政治性的运动。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"从一处移往另一处"之意。
means: move ： 普通用词，指从一处到另一外的任何距离的转移。
shift ： 侧重位置与方向的改变。
transfer ： 一般表示转送或移交迁移，尤指交通运输中的换乘或职务的调动等。
remove ： 作"移动"解时，与move可换用，还可指撤职或开除学藉等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"感动，打动"之意。
means: touch ： 主要用于表示怜悯或同情等场合，侧重感动。
inspire ： 指激起勇气和信心，侧重鼓励，有时含"启发灵感"之意。
move与touch可换用，但语气强一些，运用范围广些。

sentence.Network_en: So, if we could just move onto something else?
sentence.Network_cn: 那么我们可不可以干脆谈点别的？

sentence.Network_en: They are selling their house to move to a smaller one.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们正打算卖掉房子，然后搬到一个小一点的住处。

sentence.Network_en: If the company was to relocate, most employees would move.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果这个公司要搬迁，多数员工也要搬家。

jx.jx_en_mean: To begin to occupy a residence or place of business.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 搬进：开始占据一个住宅地或商业场所

jx.jx_en_mean: [often in imperative](informal)make a prompt start (on a journey or task)

lj.lj_ly: you're here to work, so get moving.
lj.lj_ls: 你来这儿是干活的，那就快干。

lj.lj_ly: each army was waiting for the other side to make a move.
lj.lj_ls: 双方军队都在等对方先动手。

phrase.cizu_name: make a move on (或 put the moves on)

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)make a proposition to (someone), especially of a sexual nature
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)向（某人）提出想法（尤指性要求）

jx.jx_en_mean: keep abreast of current thinking or developments
[often in imperative]change to a new position, especially to avoid causing an obstruction
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为避免拥堵而）向前走，继续前进

lj.lj_ly: ‘Move along, move along,’ said the constable.
‘Move along, move along,’ said the constable.

jx.jx_en_mean: go or cause to leave somewhere, especially because one is causing an obstruction

lj.lj_ly: the Mounties briskly ordered them to move on.
lj.lj_ls: 加拿大骑警不客气地命令他们走开。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French moveir, from Latin movere

encyclopedia.content: 英语单词用作动词 moves; moved; moving 英汉双解 vt. & vi. 1.移动； 搬动 change place or position vi. 2.搬家，迁移 change place by moving vi. 3.进展，前进，展开 advance; get nearer to an end vt. 4.使感动 cause (a person) to feel pity, sadness, anger, admiration, etc. vt. 5.提议，要求 make at a meeting (a formal suggestion on which arguments for and against are beard, and a decision taken, espec

entry.def: When you move something or when it moves, its position changes and it does not remain still.

example.ex: She moved the sheaf of papers into position...
example.tran: 她把那捆报纸挪到合适的地方。

example.ex: You can move the camera both vertically and horizontally...
example.tran: 你可以上下左右移动摄像机。

entry.def: When you move, you change your position or go to a different place.

example.ex: She waited for him to get up, but he didn't move...
example.tran: 她等他起床，但他没动弹。

example.ex: There was so much furniture you could hardly move without bumping into something...
example.tran: 家具太多，稍挪步就会撞到什么东西上。

entry.def: If you move, you act or you begin to do something.

example.ex: Industrialists must move fast to take advantage of new opportunities in Eastern Europe.
example.tran: 实业家们必须尽快采取行动，抓住东欧的新机遇。

entry.def: A move is an action that you take in order to achieve something.

example.ex: The one point cut in interest rates was a wise move...
example.tran: 将利率降低一个点是明智的举措。

example.ex: It may also be a good move to suggest she talks things over...
example.tran: 建议她把事情谈开了也许是不错的做法。

entry.def: If a person or company moves, they leave the building where they have been living or working, and they go to live or work in a different place, taking their possessions with  them.

example.ex: My family home is in York-shire and they don't want to move...
example.tran: 我家人住在约克郡，他们不打算搬家。

example.ex: She had often considered moving to London...
example.tran: 她过去常想搬到伦敦去住。

entry.def: If people in authority move someone, they make that person go from one place or job to another one.

example.ex: His superiors moved him to another parish...
example.tran: 上级把他派往另一个教区。

example.ex: Ms Clark is still in position and there are no plans to move her...
example.tran: 克拉克女士仍然在位，没有要调动她的计划。

entry.def: If you move from one job or interest to another, you change to it.

example.ex: He moved from being an extramural tutor to being a lecturer in social history...
example.tran: 他原先是一名校外辅导老师，后调入学校讲授社会史。

example.ex: In the early days Christina moved jobs to get experience.
example.tran: 起初克里斯蒂娜更换不同的工作来积累经验。

entry.tran: 改变(谈话内容);转到（新的话题）
entry.def: If you move to a new topic in a conversation, you start talking about something different.

example.ex: Let's move to another subject, Dan.
example.tran: 丹，我们换个话题吧。

entry.def: If you move an event or the date of an event, you change the time at which  it happens.

example.ex: The club has moved its meeting to Saturday, January 22nd...
example.tran: 俱乐部把会议日期改到1月22号，星期六。

example.ex: The band have moved forward their Leeds date to October 27.
example.tran: 乐队已把去利兹的日期提前至10月27号。

entry.def: If you move towards a particular state, activity, or opinion, you start to be in that state, do that activity, or have that opinion.

example.ex: The Labour Party has moved to the right and become like your Democrat Party...
example.tran: 工党已右倾化了，变得像你们民主党。

example.ex: It is already possible to start moving toward the elimination of nuclear weapons...
example.tran: 已有可能朝着消除核武器的目标努力。

entry.def: If a situation or process is moving, it is developing or progressing, rather than staying still.

example.ex: Events are moving fast...
example.tran: 事件进展迅速。

example.ex: Someone has got to get things moving.
example.tran: 应该有人牵头把事情做起来。

entry.def: If you say that you will not be moved, you mean that you have come to a decision and nothing will change your mind.

example.ex: Everyone thought I was mad to go back, but I wouldn't be moved.
example.tran: 大家都认为我回去是很不明智的，但我不会动摇。

entry.def: If something moves you to do something, it influences you and causes you to do it.

example.ex: It was punk that first moved him to join a band seriously...
example.tran: 最初是朋克摇滚乐促使他正式加入了乐队。

example.ex: The president was moved to come up with these suggestions after the hearings.
example.tran: 听证会促使总统想出了这些建议。

entry.def: If something moves you, it has an effect on your emotions and causes you to feel sadness or sympathy for another person.

example.ex: These stories surprised and moved me...
example.tran: 这些故事让我吃惊，也让我感动。

example.ex: His prayer moved me to tears.
example.tran: 他的祈祷把我感动得热泪盈眶。

entry.tran: 活跃，出入，涉足(于某团体、领域或圈子)
entry.def: If you say that someone moves in a particular society, circle, or world, you mean that they know people in a particular social class or group and spend most of their time with them.

example.ex: She moves in high-society circles in London...
example.tran: 她时常出入伦敦的上流社会。

example.ex: They moved in a world where hostility to racists was natural.
example.tran: 他们出没在一个对种族主义者的敌视习以为常的世界里。

entry.def: At a meeting, if you move a motion, you formally suggest it so that everyone present can vote on it.

example.ex: Labour quickly moved a closure motion to end the debate...
example.tran: 工党很快提出终止辩论的动议。

example.ex: I move that the case be dismissed.
example.tran: 我提议对该案不予受理。

entry.def: A move is an act of putting a chess piece or other counter in a different position on a board when it is your turn to do so in a game.

example.ex: With no idea of what to do for my next move, my hand hovered over the board.
example.tran: 我举着棋子，不知下一步该怎么走。

entry.def: If you say that one false move will cause a disaster, you mean that you or someone else must not make any mistakes because the situation is so difficult or dangerous.

example.ex: He knew one false move would end in death.
example.tran: 他明白稍有差池就会被置于死地。

entry.def: If you tell someone to get a move on, you are telling them to hurry.
If you make a move, you prepare or begin to leave one place and go somewhere else.

example.ex: He glanced at his wristwatch. 'I suppose we'd better make a move.'
example.tran: 他看一眼手表说：“我想我们最好动身吧。”

example.ex: He made a move to leave.
example.tran: 他起身离开。

entry.def: If you make a move, you take a course of action.

example.ex: The week before the deal was supposed to close, fifteen Japanese banks made a move to pull out...
example.tran: 在预定交易就要结束的前一周，15家日本银行采取行动撤离。

example.ex: Don't wait for others to make the first move: invite friends to visit you.
example.tran: 别等别人先主动，要先邀请朋友到家来。

entry.def: If you are on the move, you are going from one place to another.

example.ex: Jack never wanted to stay in one place for very long, so they were always on the move.
example.tran: 杰克从不想在一个地方呆太久，所以他们总在奔波辗转。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of deciding to do something;

sentences.sentence: "he didn't make a move to help"
"his first move was to hire a lawyer"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of changing your residence or place of business;

sentences.sentence: "they say that three moves equal one fire"

means.word_mean: 3. a change of position that does not entail a change of location;

sentences.sentence: "the reflex motion of his eyebrows revealed his surprise"
"movement is a sign of life"
"an impatient move of his hand"
"gastrointestinal motility"

means.word_mean: 4. the act of changing location from one place to another;

sentences.sentence: "police controlled the motion of the crowd"
"the movement of people from the farms to the cities"
"his move put him directly in my path"

means.word_mean: 5. (game) a player's turn to move a piece or take some other permitted action
1. change location; move, travel, or proceed;

sentences.sentence: "How fast does your new car go?"
"We travelled from Rome to Naples by bus"
"The policemen went from door to door looking for the suspect"
"The soldiers moved towards the city in an attempt to take it before night fell"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to move, both in a concrete and in an abstract sense;

sentences.sentence: "Move those boxes into the corner, please"
"I'm moving my money to another bank"
"The director moved more responsibilities onto his new assistant"

means.word_mean: 3. move so as to change position, perform a nontranslational motion;

sentences.sentence: "He moved his hand slightly to the right"

means.word_mean: 4. change residence, affiliation, or place of employment;

sentences.sentence: "We moved from Idaho to Nebraska"
"The basketball player moved from one team to another"

means.word_mean: 5. follow a procedure or take a course;

sentences.sentence: "We should go farther in this matter"
"She went through a lot of trouble"
"go about the world in a certain manner"
"Messages must go through diplomatic channels"

means.word_mean: 6. be in a state of action;

sentences.sentence: "she is always moving"

means.word_mean: 7. go or proceed from one point to another;

sentences.sentence: "the debate moved from family values to the economy"

means.word_mean: 8. perform an action, or work out or perform (an action);

sentences.sentence: "think before you act"
"We must move quickly"
"The governor should act on the new energy bill"
"The nanny acted quickly by grabbing the toddler and covering him with a wet towel"

means.word_mean: 9. have an emotional or cognitive impact upon;

sentences.sentence: "This child impressed me as unusually mature"
"This behavior struck me as odd"
"This moved me to sacrifice my career"
"Her fate moved us all"
"The chairman of the company told the salesmen to move the computers"
"The speech has to go through several more drafts"
"run through your presentation before the meeting"

means.word_mean: 14. live one's life in a specified environment;

sentences.sentence: "she moves in certain circles only"

means.word_mean: 15. have a turn; make one's move in a game;

sentences.sentence: "Can I go now?"

means.word_mean: 16. propose formally; in a debate or parliamentary meeting

example.en: He stopped everything to put a move on that Russian woman.
example.zh: 他把手头的事情都放下来，去向那个俄国女人调情。

auth_sentence.content: They could gradually move others to a new system.
auth_sentence.res_content: They could gradually move others to a new system.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They could gradually move others to a new system.

auth_sentence.content: The move came just weeks after it joined Nato.
auth_sentence.res_content: The move came just weeks after it joined Nato.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The move came just weeks after it joined Nato.

auth_sentence.content: We were going to move in after the election.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were going to move in after the election.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were going to move in after the election.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 移动, 迁居, 步骤
stems_affixes.word_buile: mov运动+e→n.&v.移动, 迁居, 步骤

sentences.en: He is going to move his furniture.
sentences.cn: 他打算把家具移动一下位置。

means.word_mean: 进展, 前进, 展开; 采取行动; 做（事）

sentences.en: Work on this new building is moving more quickly than was expected.
sentences.cn: 这座新楼的建筑工程进展得比预期的快。

sentences.en: A few leaves were moving in the wind.
Let's move on before it's too late.

means.word_mean: 呼吁；申请；提议(常与for连用)

sentences.en: The plaintiff moved for a rehearing.
We must move at once in this matter.
sentences.cn: 对这件事我们必须立刻采取行动。

means.word_mean: 使感动, 激起, 打动

sentences.en: The news moved him very much.
I move that we adopt the agenda as it stands.
sentences.cn: 我提议不作改变通过这个议程。

means.word_mean: 影响，促使，迫使（某人…）；使去做

sentences.en: his deep love of music moved him to take the lessons.
sentences.cn: 他对音乐的热爱促使他去上这些课。

sentences.en: The wind was moving the branches.
The snake made a small move.
One careless move loses the whole game.
sentences.cn: 一着不慎, 全盘皆输。

sentences.en: Unless we make a move soon, we shall not be able to fulfill our plan.
sentences.cn: 如果不赶快采取行动, 我们就不能完成计划了。

sentences.en: We'll make a move to the city next week.
sentences.cn: 我们下星期要搬家到这个城市来。

jushi.english: Work on the new building is moving more quickly than was expected.
jushi.chinese: 新建筑工程进展得比预期的要快。
